Execution Modules¶

splunk.add_batch_of_saved_search(name_prefix, count, **kwargs)¶

Create a batch of saved search/report/alert http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/admin/Savedsearchesconf

Parameters:
  • name_prefix – prefix name of saved search
  • count – number of search is going to create
  • kwargs – any data under a saved search stanza, ex. search=”*”
Returns:

None
splunk.add_batch_of_user(username_prefix, user_count, roles)¶

Create a large group of user on splunk, user and password are the same

Parameters:
  • username_prefix – username_prefix, the username will be in form of <prefix><number>
  • user_count – number of user to be created
  • roles – role of user add to, could be a list or a single role
splunk.add_license(license_path)¶
Parameters:license_path (string) – where the license is. It should be start with ‘salt://’
splunk.allow_remote_login()¶

config allowRemoteLogin under server.conf

splunk.bootstrap_shcluster_captain(servers_list=None)¶

bootstrap a splunk instance as a captain of a search head cluster captain

Parameters:servers_list – list of shc members, ex. https://192.168.0.2:8089,https://192.168.0.3:8089
splunk.cli(command)¶

run splunk cli

Parameters:command – splunk cli command, ex. ‘add listen 9997’
splunk.config_cluster_master(pass4SymmKey, replication_factor=2, search_factor=2)¶

config splunk as a master of a indexer cluster http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Indexer/Configurethemaster

Parameters:
  • search_factor – factor of bucket be able to search
  • replication_factor – factor of bucket be able to replicate
  • pass4SymmKey – it’s a key to communicate between indexer cluster
splunk.config_cluster_searchhead(pass4SymmKey, master_uri=None)¶

config splunk as a search head of a indexer cluster http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Indexer/Enableclustersindetail

Parameters:
  • pass4SymmKey – is a key to communicate between indexer cluster
  • master_uri – <ip>:<port> of mgmt_uri, ex 127.0.0.1:8089, if not specified, will search minion under same master with role splunk-cluster-master
splunk.config_cluster_slave(pass4SymmKey, master_uri=None, replication_port=9887)¶

config splunk as a peer(indexer) of a indexer cluster http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Indexer/Configurethepeers

Parameters:
  • replication_port – port to replicate data
  • master_uri – <ip>:<port> of mgmt_uri, ex 127.0.0.1:8089, if not specified, will search minion under same master with role splunk-cluster-master
  • pass4SymmKey – is a key to communicate between indexer cluster
splunk.config_conf(conf_name, stanza_name, data=None, do_restart=True, namespace='system')¶

config conf file by REST, if a data is existed, it will skip

Parameters:
  • namespace –
  • conf_name – name of config file
  • stanza_name – stanza need to config
  • data – data under stanza
  • do_restart – restart after configuration
Returns:

no return value
Raises:

EnvironmentError – if restart fail
splunk.config_deployment_client(server=None)¶

config deploymeny client

Parameters:server – mgmt uri of deployment server
splunk.config_license_slave(master_uri)¶

config license slave

Parameters:master_uri (string) – uri of the license master
splunk.config_search_peer(servers=None, remote_username='admin', remote_password='changeme')¶

config splunk as a peer of a distributed search environment http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/DistSearch/Configuredistributedsearch#Edit_distsearch.conf

Parameters:
  • remote_username – splunk username of the search peer
  • remote_password – splunk password of the search peer
  • servers – <ip>:<port>,<ip>:<port>
splunk.config_shcluster_deployer(pass4SymmKey, shcluster_label)¶

config splunk as a deployer of the search head cluster

Returns:result of splunk restart
splunk.config_shcluster_member(pass4SymmKey, shcluster_label, replication_factor, replication_port, conf_deploy_fetch_url=None)¶

config splunk as a member of a search head cluster

Parameters:
  • conf_deploy_fetch_url – deployer’s mgmt uri
  • replication_port – replication port for SHC
  • replication_factor – replication factor for SHC
  • shcluster_label – shcluster’s label
  • pass4SymmKey – pass4SymmKey for SHC
splunk.get_cluster_master_mgmt_uri(target='role:splunk-cluster-master', expr='grain')¶

get mgmt uri of splunk instance with ‘role:splunk-cluster-master’

Parameters:
  • expr – how would you like to target your cluster master
  • target – the value to target the cluster master
Returns:

uri of ‘role:splunk-cluster-master’ in <ip>:<port> form

splunk.install(fetcher_arg, type='splunk', fetcher_url='http://r.susqa.com/cgi-bin/splunk_build_fetcher.py', start_after_install=True, is_upgrade=False, splunk_home=None, **kwargs)¶

install Splunk

Parameters:
  • splunk_home (string) – path for splunk install to
  • fetcher_arg (string) – arguments which you want to pass the release fetcher
  • type (string) – splunk, splunkforwarder or splunklite
  • fetcher_url (string) – url of the release fetcher
  • start_after_install (boolean) – True if you want to start splunk right after installation
  • is_upgrade (bool) – True if you want to upgrade splunk
Return type:

dict
Returns:

command line result in dict [‘retcode’, ‘stdout’, ‘stderr’]
splunk.is_installed()¶

check if splunk is installed or not

Returns:True if splunk is installed, else False
Return type:Boolean
